span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

span.span: LATEST UPDATES FROM CORVALLIS SCHOOL DISTRICT #1

font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif;
font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.a: Common Troubleshooting Help for Students and Parents
A Parents Guide to Google Classroom

div.p: If you cannot find the answers that you are looking for you can contact the state directly using this email: opicovid19@mt.gov

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-weight: 400;

p.span: Good Afternoon Corvallis families, the Governor has extended the school closure and stay at home order through April 24th. Staff will continue to provide remote/online learning services. For families utilizing paper packets, our first packet pick up will be tomorrow, 4/9 between 7:30-10:00 AM at the Central Office (just north of the Cafeteria parking lot). Please pull up to the front of the building and tell staff your child’s teacher’s name and your child’s last and we will bring materials out to you. Please be patient as we work through this process for the first time as there are extra materials needing to go home. If you are unable to come at that time please arrange for someone else to pick up your child’s materials or contact your building principal directly to make other arrangements. Please be watching for a letter in your mailbox with information about your rights regarding online/remote learning via online resources. Tim Johnson, Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Good Afternoon Corvallis families, Included with this email is the board approved plan for remote/online learning beginning April 6th. It will also be posted on our website. The Governor’s directive does not alter our ability to provide essential services. We will continue to provide services to families including food, educational hard copy materials for those who do not have electronic means, maintain communications with families including voice messages and emails, and fulfill appointments as necessary. Central Office hours are compressed to 11 AM – 1 PM, or by appointment. Thank you for your cooperation and have a restful spring break.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Tim Johnson, Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: With the extended school closure to April 10, staff and students will be implementing full online/remote learning starting April 6. Corvallis School District Staff, students and families are now going to be required to do school in ways we’ve never done before. This is a stress for everyone. The school board will approve and submit to the state our remote learning plan. As you are well aware, we are trying to provide families with all the resources we can to accomplish this plan. We need your help in executing this plan to help our students continue their education. Quarter three grades will be finalized April 10. Included with this message is a PDF of parent, student and teacher expectations.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: italic; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Extended School Closure

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Good Afternoon, Governor Bullock has extended the school closure through April 10, 2020. As a result, Corvallis School District will be implementing full online/remote learning and content after spring break. Spring Break is still a scheduled vacation March 30 – April 3. More details about this shift in learning will be sent out this week.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: T

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: he following is a message from Ravalli County. All future updates will be through Facebook and our District Web page. Today Ravalli County officials set up an Incident Management team to undertake the Coronavirus issue. The unified command is made up of Jeff Burrows, Dr. Carol Calderwood, and Karyn Johnston, County Health Nurse. According to IC Burrows, there are so many rumors circulating we know we need to provide accurate, timely, information. Specifically, we are making decisions based on the information and what is best for our community. At this time, there are no reported positive cases in Ravalli County, and we are not closing bars and restaurants although many businesses have taken steps to limit the number of people that can come in and doing extra cleaning. All decisions are evolving and will change. We are asking the public to remain calm and take steps to protect yourself by washing hands, practicing social distancing, and remain home if you are sick. We are in this together, and we will get through this as we have with passed incidents in our Valley. The most current information can be found on Ravalli County homepage at www.ravalli.us or by calling 406-375-6650. For immediate information signup for the Ravalli County Sheriff’s application.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Tuesday, March 17, 2020

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Important Updates (please read the entire message, 3/17/20)

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Updated status regarding the students and staff returning from Wyoming. Individuals that were tested for COVID-19 were negative. For more information about COVID-19 please visit the

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: , or our

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: In the event that our school closure extends beyond spring break we would like to assess the needs of our students. Thank you for taking time to respond to this survey.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;
background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The next food service pick-up will occur in the middle school parking lot Thursday, March 19 between 7:30 – 10:00 AM. You will be able to pick up a bag containing 2 breakfasts and 2 lunches for each child 18 years of age or younger. We plan to provide the same service next week on Tuesday and Thursday (3/24 & 3/26).

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Text: Important Updates were just sent through Infinite Campus messenger. Please check your email or the district web page.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Monday, March 16th, 2020

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Charter will offer free Spectrum broadband and wifi access for 60 days to households with K-12 and /or college students who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription. To enroll call 1-844-488-8395. Installation fees will be waived for the new students households..

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Sunday, March 15th, 2020 8:48PM

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Corvallis School District will be providing food service in the middle school parking lot, between 7:30 – 10:00 AM on Tuesday, March 17 you will receive two breakfasts and two lunches for each child 18 years of age or younger at no cost. We will also provide this service from 7:30 – 10:00 AM on Thursday, March 19, 2020. These meals will be provided based on availability. The buildings will be open tomorrow Monday, March 16th from 12:00 – 6:00 PM for students to grab personal items from lockers. We will be communicating all updates through Infinite Campus and staff will be checking and responding to email regularly. All spring sports, adult education classes, and events are cancelled until April 6th, 2020. This includes all practices, facilities, games, meets, concerts and musicals, school sponsored or otherwise. After March 16th, no one should be accessing school facilities including the CCEC.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Sunday, March 15th, 2020 3:24PM

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Good afternoon, At the recommendation of Ravalli County Health Department, Corvallis Public Schools #1 will be closed through Spring Break (April 5th) tentatively returning to school on April 6th. The closure of Corvallis Schools is not taken lightly and is responding to the recommendation by the Ravalli County Health Department. Our School Board will be holding a special meeting tomorrow night at 6pm to review and determine any other needs that need to be addressed. This board meeting is an open meeting however, we ask that those who wish to attend do so within the expectations and guidance related to current health concerns. Staff are to report Monday to finalize the delivery of online content, the planning of which began last week. Food service will also be determining acceptable methods to assist children who are in need of meals we typically provide during a normal week. I appreciate and thank all of our families and residents during these tumultuous times. Updates will occur through this and social media outlets.

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Tim Johnson, Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Thursday, March 12th, 2020

span.style: background-color: transparent; color: #000000; font-family: Quicksand, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Good Afternoon Parents and Staff,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: The Corvallis School District is committed to do our part in providing a safe and healthy learning environment for our students and community. Over the past few days, we’ve all witnessed an increasing concern as it relates to the spread of a Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) that causes the disease called COVID19. Under these circumstances, we rely upon other authoritative agencies to guide our response to Coronavirus and other contagious illnesses. While we currently do not have any confirmed cases of Coronavirus in Ravalli County or Montana, it is reasonable to expect the ‘landscape’ to change rapidly. For links to the latest information about the Coronavirus, visit our homepage.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: At Tuesday’s School Board meeting there was much discussion regarding District approved travel. Travel will be scrutinized on a case by case basis using the most up to date information from sources such as the CDC, the county and state public health office. Likewise, regular District operations are contingent upon our needs and guidance from OPI and our local public health office. Please understand that this is an evolving situation and the Corvallis School District will be as responsive as possible. Last week we published a link on our District’s homepage with resources and guidance related to this illness.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Additionally, our maintenance staff have further refined their facility cleaning protocols. Building staff are reinforcing with our students the importance of hand washing among other hygiene habits that address the spread of this and other illnesses. Please visit our homepage for links to specific advice from the CDC and other public health organizations regarding identifying symptoms and reasonable actions to take if you suspect yourself or a family member is becoming ill. Any limitations to educational services will be in coordination with state and county public health officials and communicated through Infinite Campus Messenger, social media, and other new sharing networks (TV, radio). Thank you for your help and diligence in working through these challenging times.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Quicksand,sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Tim Johnson, Superintendent

p.a: Common Troubleshooting Help for Students and Parents
A Parents Guide to Google Classroom

div.p: If you cannot find the answers that you are looking for you can contact the state directly using this email: opicovid19@mt.gov

The Core Purpose of the Corvallis School District is to achieve excellence in educating the whole child in a safe environment so that students are prepared to succeed in life and become productive members of society.
